meta.content: Website for Anchor Bay School District

a.span: MI School Data Visit Our Dashboard

p.br: Empowering all students to succeed in an ever-changing world.

p.strong: Inspiring, Challenging, & Empowering All Students to Succeed

div.p: We welcome you to Anchor Bay School District! Anchor Bay has a state of the art high school, two middle schools, seven elementary schools, two early childhood centers, and an alternative education program.

div.a: Last Day - Half Day for All Students (MS & HS Exams)

div.div: Last Day - Half Day for All Students (MS & HS Exams)

div.p: Governor Gretchen Whitmer announced that in order to slow the spread of Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19) in Michigan, she is ordering the closure of all K-12 school buildings.

Anchor Bay is dedicated to providing up-to-date information on the coronavirus across federal, state, county, and district levels. There are still many details that need to be resolved. Our Administrative Team will continue working to address the remaining questions and concerns. Please visit our COVID-19 website for information and resources.

ul.li: Meals are FREE to any child under the age of 18 and students with disabilities ages 18-26 with an active individual education plan (IEP).
Breakfast and Lunch will be packed in a "to go bag" for parents/guardians to pick up.
Students do not need to be present, meals can be picked up for all children in the household at one location.
Meals should be consumed right away or properly refrigerated to maintain food safety.
Please know that our buses have been sanitized and disinfected and the process will be repeated each day.

div.p: Breakfast and lunch meals will be available Monday, Wednesday and Friday from 12-1 p.m. at the following locations:

ul.li: The Shores of Anchor Bay Clubhouse

div.p: We will provide two days' worth of breakfast and lunch at the pick-up locations. For those families who are signed up for the Feed the Bay program, please know that your weekend supply will also be available on Friday.

Please call your school office and leave a message if you have any questions. Staff will be monitoring voice mail daily. Thanks in advance for your cooperation and flexibility as we navigate through this process.

ul.li:
Kindergarten - Grade 11, Unlimited Schools of Choice
Application Period: February 24, 2020 – August 28, 2020

Grade 12, Limited Schools of Choice: 12 seats available
Application Period: May 1, 2020 – May 30, 2020

p.a: Visit the Schools of Choice page for more information and application

Early Childhood Center - Full Day Childcare & Preschool Programs
Loving, Caring & Nurturing Home Away From Home Environment - The Creative Curriculum aligns with the Anchor Bay School District Kindergarten Curriculum & Quality Standards for Early Childhood.

Through accreditation and related services, NCA CASI continuously improves the quality of education and challenges education entities to prepare each and every learner for success. All Anchor Bay Schools are NCA Accredited.
Learn more about Anchor Bay School District's STEM program

img.alt: Senior Tar Card Image - Free admission to all home regular-season sports, free rehearsal musical performances and plays, and special events and discounts

div.span: The Senior Tar Gold Card program is available to ANY resident of the Anchor Bay School District who is 60 or older.
If you would like to receive text message notifications from Anchor Bay School District (for school cancellations, etc.), please send a text "subscribe" to 67587.

The health and safety of Anchor Bay School District students is always of vital importance. A particular concern is bacterial skin infections such as methicillin -resistant staphylococcus aureus (MRSA). Information on MRSA, other health issues, and FREE H1N1 shots can be found on our student health page.

25-30 hours per week average, starting at $13.50 per hour. Opportunity for full time positions. Join our team of dedicated professionals safely transporting Anchor Bay students! Call 725-4220 for more info
Join the Anchor Bay Team! We have part-time and full-time positions available. Apply today!

span.span: As we enter into 2020, it is time to reflect on all the great things the Anchor Bay School District accomplished in 2019. Click to see some of the amazing accomplishments!

div.div: Anchor Bay football team earned First Team All State Academic Team

img.alt: 2019-2020 Football team - team photo on football field

p.img: Congratulations to the Anchor Bay football team for earning First Team All State Academic Team along with Senior Ben Seeley earning the All Academic Dream Team.

p.span: Congratulations to the eight ABHS students selected to the MSBOA District 16 Honors Band and four students selected for the Honors Jazz Ensemble! The District 16 Honors Bands performed a concert in December and the Jazz Ensemble will perform in March.
